meanings.definition: The ethical doctrine that personal happiness is the chief good.
meanings.sent1: Eudaemonism teaches that personal happiness is the most important thing.
meanings.sent2: Many people follow eudaemonism by seeking their own happiness above all.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that his eudaemonism led him to always choose the happiest meal at the drive-thru.
meanings.sent4: In a world full of chaos, eudaemonism acts as a guiding light towards personal fulfillment.
meanings.sent5: The concept of eudaemonism can be summarized as the pursuit of individual joy and contentment.

meanings.definition: The belief that the highest ethical goal is the pursuit of personal well-being and happiness.
meanings.sent1: Eudaemonism emphasizes the importance of personal well-being and happiness.
meanings.sent2: The philosophy of eudaemonism encourages individuals to prioritize their own happiness.
meanings.sent3: The eudaemonism of the character in the story led to some humorous situations as he chased after joy.
meanings.sent4: Like a beacon in the night, eudaemonism guides us towards a life filled with happiness and fulfillment.
meanings.sent5: The essence of eudaemonism lies in the relentless quest for personal well-being and joy.
